name: HD 202772 A
scenarioDescription:
The HD 202772 A Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 202772 A is a star with 1.72 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.59 times its radius. It is located 480.10 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 202772 A is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 202772 A system


HD 202772 A b

HD 202772 A b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 202772 A b is 323.40599999999995 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 202772 A b is 17.318 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 202772 A b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 202772 A, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
